ovdesc.p:
While the Property Classes define the fundamental building blocks, a more specific classification
is necessary to fully describe a product. For example a loan product may require more than one type of “Interest”
(i.e. “normal interest” and “penalty interest”). To satisfy this requirement the Product Builder has a concept of
a Property which is a named type of Property Class.

Example Properties of the “Interest” class would be “principal interest”, “penalty
interest”, “credit interest”, “debit interest”, etc. Each of these Properties would share a common set of
characteristics and processing. It is in fact these lower level Properties to which defined conditions (i.e.
specific interest rates) are attached in order to create the products that are available for sale.

While the Property Classes are defined and released by Temenos, the underlying Properties are
created and maintained by users. Any number of Properties can be defined providing an extremely powerful and
flexible means of creating new innovative products. For example if a product type was desired that required three
separate interest rates with different calculation methods the user would simply create (or reuse) the three
Properties of an “Interest” Property Class.

Once the necessary Properties have been created, the designer can use them to define a
Product Group by specifying the mandatory and optional Properties which comprise it.

desc.p: Any alphanumeric character can be used to define the name of the property.
Maximum of 15 characters are allowed.
Identifies the Property Class that this AA.PROPERTY record belongs to.
Mandatory Input. Input must be a valid AA.PROPERTY.CLASS ID.

Certain properties are released by Temenos for mapping the existing parameter tables from AA
product conditions. A value of YES in this field would indicate that it is a property used for such purposes.
This is a system maintained field and cannot be edited

The options are NULL, PRODUCT.ONLY, SUSPEND, SUSPEND.OVERDUES, ACCRUAL.BY.BILLS, CREDIT,
RESIDUAL.ACCRUAL, FORWARD DATED, VARIATION, COMMISSION and REBATE UNAMORTISED.

PRODUCT.ONLY - If this is selected, the details for this Property are defined only at product level and
cannot be viewed or edited at arrangement level. For example for properties which use ACCOUNTING class, it is
highly unlikely that the user would need to define or modify accounting rules for each arrangement. Hence defining
them at the product would suffice.

SUSPEND - If this is selected, it would mean that the property would be allowed to suspend. Only
INTEREST and CHARGE properties can be suspend.

SUSPEND.OVERDUE - If this is defined, it would mean that any overdues in the property will also be
suspended when property is suspend. To define SUSPEND.OVERDUE, the property should already be set to SUSPEND.
ACCRUAL.BY.BILLS – If selected,it performs accrual update in bills.

CREDIT - This is to state that the property Needs to raise Credit entry or Debit entry. Default type is
Debit.If CREDIT is specified for charge then it will be considered as bonus.

RESIDUAL ACCRUAL - This is to make difference between the TOT.ACCR.AMT and the Amount made due to move
under RES balance type.
FORWARD DATED - This is introduced to display future dated conditions.

VARIATION - This is stated so that proofing would check for the existence of variations
(GOLD/PLATINUM/INTERNET).Rules to check whether customers are satisfied these variations will be
defined in eligibility condition.

REBATE UNAMORTISED - Normal charges without property type as “REBATE.UNAMORT” can be set to amortize.
When an arrangement with such a charge definition is paid off, it should recognise the unamortised amount
immediately, without depending on the configuration in payment schedule
COMMISSION - This is introduced to identify charges those are used as commissions.

The prefix to be used to create the new AC.BALANCE.TYPE record. AA provides flexibility for the
user to create their own properties and the balances that are linked to those properties. To create balances the
standard prefix defined for the class of this property is defaulted here.
Noinput and system maintained field.
Describes the AA.PROPERTY and is used for enrichment.

This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the AA.PROPERTY in
various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table
(Ref: GENERAL TABLES), and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered.
